intro: Goniophlebium myrtillifolium, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved flax, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish underside. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Goniophlebium myrtillifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
